p: Kidney markers (urea and creatinine) changes were also shown in Table 3. The results found that non treated diabetic mice displayed a significant ( p < 0.001) increase in urea and creatinine as compared to normal control. On the other hand, the groups that received the PCS and glibenclamide significantly reduced their creatinine and urea levels in comparison to the diabetic group ( p < 0.001). Their elevated level indicates a progressive renal damage [ 36] prevented by the administration of different treatments.
